intro: Cyclostemon euryodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cyclostemon, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or wetland habitats. Cyclostemon euryodes is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
